Name: Engine Fuel Valve 1 Inlet Absolute Pressure
Description: The absolute pressure of gas on the inlet side of the first system control valve.  See SPN 3466 for Engine Fuel Valve 2.

Name: Engine Fuel Valve Differential Pressure
Description: The differential pressure between the inlet and the outlet of a gaseous fuel valve.

Name: Engine Air to Fuel Differential Pressure
Description: The differential pressure between the gaseous fuel and the air intake manifold.

Name: Engine Fuel  Valve 1 Outlet Absolute Pressure
Description: Absolute Pressure of gas on outlet side of the first or only fuel system control valve.  See SPN 3469 for the second fuel control valve.

Name: Auxiliary Temperature 1
Description: Temperature measured by auxiliary temperature sensor #1.  Not to be used in place of existing SPNs.

Name: Auxiliary Temperature 2
Description: Temperature measured by auxiliary temperature sensor #2.  Not to be used in place of existing SPNs.

Name: Auxiliary Pressure #1
Description: Pressure measured by auxiliary pressure sensor #1.  Not to be used in place of existing SPNs.

Name: Auxiliary Pressure #2
Description: Pressure measured by auxiliary pressure sensor #2.  Not to be used in place of existing SPNs.

Name: Auxiliary Level
Description: Level measured by a sensor.

Name: Relative Humidity
Description: Measures humidity of combustion air prior to entry into turbocharger

Name: Battery Potential / Power Input 2
Description: This parameter measures the second source of battery potential as measured at the input of the ECM/actuator etc. coming from one or more batteries, irrespective of the distance between the component and the battery.  This SPN is also used when ECM's are interconnected in a series configuration, where the source of power is coming directly or indirectly from the same battery/batteries.

Name: ECU Power Output Supply Voltage #1
Description: The first power output from an ECM

Name: ECU Power Output Supply Voltage #2
Description: The second power output from an ECM.

Name: ECU Power Output Supply Voltage #3
Description: The third power output from an ECM.

Name: Service Component Identification
Description: Identification of component needing service.  See Table SPN911_A.

Name: Time Since Last Service
Description: The vehicle operation time since the last service was performed.  The type of service information is identified by the service component identification number.

Name: Engine External Shutdown Air Supply Pressure
Description: Pressure of the air used to shut off the fuel supply to the engine.

Name: Number of Engine Torque History Records
Description: Number of torque history records contained in the engine torque history PGN.  A value of 0 is broadcast if no torque history records are stored in the ECU.

Name: Engine Power
Description: Advertised engine power capability.  Advertised power is what a customer will find on a sales sheet for an engine with a certain calibration.

Name: Engine Peak Torque 1
Description: Maximum torque output of the current ECU calibration when the engine operates on torque curve 1.  For calibrations that support two torque curves, this parameter shall be assigned the value of the lower curve.  For calibrations that support only one curve, this parameter should be used.

Name: Engine Peak Torque 2
Description: Maximum torque output of the current ECU calibration when the engine operates on torque curve 2.  For calibrations that support two torque curves, this parameter shall be assigned the value of the higher curve.  For calibrations that support only one curve, this parameter should to set to “not available”.

Name: Calibration Record Start Month
Description:
Calendar month timestamp when an ECU record was established.

NOTE - A value of 0 for the month is null.  The value 1 identifies January; 2 identifies February; etc.

Name: Calibration Record Start Day
Description:
Calendar day timestamp when an ECU record was established.

NOTE - A value of 0 for the date is null.  The values 1, 2, 3, and 4 are used to identify the first day of the month; 5, 6, 7, and 8 identify the second day of the month; etc.

Name: Calibration Record Start Year
Description:
Calendar year timestamp when an ECU record was established.

NOTE - A value of 0 for the year identifies the year 1985; a value of 1 identifies 1986; etc.

Name: Calibration Record Duration Time
Description: Duration in hours for which the engine operated in the conditions captured in the current record.

Name: Torque Limiting Feature Status
Description:
Status of an ECU feature which limits the torque output of the engine. 

00 - Disabled
01 - Enabled
10 - Error
11 - Not available

Name: Engine Torque Limit Feature
Description:
Torque limit rating described in the current record. 

000 Reserved
001 Highest torque rating
010 First torque rating
011 Previous torque rating (rating prior to the current rating)
100 Current torque rating
101-110 Reserved
111 Not available

Name: Transmission Gear Ratio 1
Description: Gear ratio value stored in the ECU that is used to define a range of transmission gears for which a limit is applied to the engine output torque.  Transmission gear ratio 1 should be the numerically highest transmission gear ratio breakpoint that defines ratio ranges for torque limits.

Name: Engine Torque Limit 1, Transmission
Description: Limit applied to the engine output torque during vehicle operation in transmission gear ratios numerically greater than transmission gear ratio 1 (see SPN 1255).

Name: Transmission Gear Ratio 2
Description: Gear ratio value stored in the ECU that is used to define a range of transmission gears for which a limit is applied to the engine output torque.  Transmission gear ratio 2 should be the numerically highest transmission gear ratio breakpoint less than transmission gear ratio 1 (see SPN 1255) that defines ratio ranges for torque limits.

Name: Engine Torque Limit 2, Transmission
Description: Limit applied to the engine output torque during vehicle operation in transmission gear ratios numerically less than or equal to transmission gear ratio 1 (see SPN 1255) and numerically greater than transmission gear ratio 2 (see.SPN 1257).  For example, with transmission gear ratio 1 equal to 12.0:1 and transmission gear ratio 2 equal to 5.0:1, vehicle operation in a transmission gear with a ratio of 6.0:1 will result in the application of engine torque limit 2, transmission.

Name: Transmission Gear Ratio 3
Description: Gear ratio value stored in the ECU that is used to define a range of transmission gears for which a limit is applied to the engine output torque.  Transmission gear ratio 3 should be the numerically highest transmission gear ratio breakpoint less than transmission gear ratio 2 (see SPN 1257) that defines ratio ranges for torque limits.

Name: Engine Torque Limit 3, Transmission
Description: Limit applied to the engine output torque during vehicle operation in transmission gear ratios numerically less than or equal to transmission gear ratio 2 (see SPN 1257) and numerically greater than transmission gear ratio 3 (see.SPN 1259).  For example, with transmission gear ratio 2 equal to 5.0:1 and transmission gear ratio 3 equal to 2.0:1, vehicle operation in a transmission gear with a ratio of 3.0:1 will result in the application of engine torque limit 3, transmission.

Name: Engine Torque Limit 4, Transmission
Description: Limit applied to the engine output torque during vehicle operation in transmission gear ratios numerically less than or equal to transmission gear ratio 3 (see SPN 1259).

Name: Engine Torque Limit 5, Switch
Description: Limit applied to the engine output torque based on activation of an ECU switch input.

Name: Engine Torque Limit 6, Axle Input
Description: Limit applied to the engine output torque based on the maximum allowable axle input torque.  Axle input torque is calculated as the current engine torque output multiplied by the transmission gear ratio.

Name: Engine Fuel Leakage 1
Description:
Status signal which indicates fuel leakage in the fuel rail of the engine. Location can be either before or after the fuel pump.  

00 - no leakage detected
01 - leakage detected
10 - Error
11 - Not available

Name: Engine Fuel Leakage 2
Description:
Status signal which indicates fuel leakage in the fuel rail of the engine. Location can be either before or after the fuel pump.  

00 - no leakage detected
01 - leakage detected
10 - Error
11 - Not available

Name: Engine Pre-filter Oil Pressure
Description: Gage pressure of the engine oil before the oil reaches the oil filter.

Name: Engine Exhaust Gas Pressure
Description: Gage pressure of the exhaust gasses as measured at the turbine inlet of the turbocharger.

Name: Engine Fuel Rack Position
Description: Measured position of the engine fuel rack.  A value of 0% rack represents no fueling and a value of 100% rack represents maximum fueling.

Name: Engine Gas Mass Flow Rate 1
Description: Gas mass flow rate delivered to an engine through its first fuel control system.  See SPN 3467 for the second fuel control system.

Name: Instantaneous Estimated Brake Power
Description: Estimate of the power developed by the engine.

Name: Electrical Load
Description: Electrical power delivered by the engine to the electrical system connected to the generator.

Name: Safety Wire Status
Description:
Status signal which indicates that the safety wire has been activated.  When the safety wire is activated, the engine will not operate.  This is used for maintenance purposes.

00 - Safety wire has not been activated
01 - Safety wire has been activated
10 - Error
11 - Not available

Name: Engine Auxiliary Coolant Pressure
Description: Gage pressure of coolant found in the intercooler which is located after the turbocharger.

Name: Engine Auxiliary Coolant Temperature
Description: Temperature of coolant found in the intercooler which is located after the turbocharger.

Name: Sea Water Pump Outlet Pressure
Description: Gauge pressure of liquid found at outlet of sea water pump in sea water cooling system.

Name: Engine Operation Time Since Rebuild
Description: The time in engine operation since the last engine rebuild.

Name: Engine Turbocharger 1 Wastegate Drive
Description: Position of the wastegate drive.  A value of 0% represents fully closed and a value of 100% represents fully open.

Name: Engine Turbocharger 2 Wastegate Drive
Description: Position of the wastegate drive.  A value of 0% represents fully closed and a value of 100% represents fully open.

Name: Engine Turbocharger 3 Wastegate Drive
Description: Position of the wastegate drive.  A value of 0% represents fully closed and a value of 100% represents fully open.

Name: Engine Turbocharger 4 Wastegate Drive
Description: Position of the wastegate drive.  A value of 0% represents fully closed and a value of 100% represents fully open.

Name: Engine Turbocharger Wastegate Actuator Control Air Pressure
Description: Gage pressure of the air used to control the actuator which opens and closes the wastegate valve.

Name: Engine Turbocharger 1 Turbine Outlet Temperature
Description: Temperature of the combustion by-products exiting the turbine side of the turbocharger.

Name: Engine Turbocharger 2 Turbine Outlet Temperature
Description: Temperature of the combustion by-products exiting the turbine side of the turbocharger.

Name: Engine Turbocharger 3 Turbine Outlet Temperature
Description: Temperature of the combustion by-products exiting the turbine side of the turbocharger.

Name: Engine Turbocharger 4 Turbine Outlet Temperature
Description: Temperature of the combustion by-products exiting the turbine side of the turbocharger.

Name: Engine Turbocharger 1 Turbine Inlet Temperature
Description: Temperature of the combustion by-products entering the turbine side of the turbocharger.

Name: Engine Turbocharger 2 Turbine Inlet Temperature
Description: Temperature of the combustion by-products entering the turbine side of the turbocharger.

Name: Engine Turbocharger 3 Turbine Inlet Temperature
Description: Temperature of the combustion by-products entering the turbine side of the turbocharger.

Name: Engine Turbocharger 4 Turbine Inlet Temperature
Description: Temperature of the combustion by-products entering the turbine side of the turbocharger.

Name: Engine Turbocharger 1 Compressor Inlet Pressure
Description: Gage pressure of the air entering the compressor side of the turbocharger.

Name: Engine Turbocharger 2 Compressor Inlet Pressure
Description: Gage pressure of the air entering the compressor side of the turbocharger.

Name: Engine Turbocharger 3 Compressor Inlet Pressure
Description: Gage pressure of the air entering the compressor side of the turbocharger.

Name: Engine Turbocharger 4 Compressor Inlet Pressure
Description: Gage pressure of the air entering the compressor side of the turbocharger.

Name: Engine Turbocharger 1 Compressor Inlet Temperature
Description: Temperature of the air entering the compressor side of the turbocharger.

Name: Engine Turbocharger 2 Compressor Inlet Temperature
Description: Temperature of the air entering the compressor side of the turbocharger.

Name: Engine Turbocharger 3 Compressor Inlet Temperature
Description: Temperature of the air entering the compressor side of the turbocharger.

Name: Engine Turbocharger 4 Compressor Inlet Temperature
Description: Temperature of the air entering the compressor side of the turbocharger.

Name: Engine Turbocharger Lube Oil Pressure 2
Description: Gage pressure of oil in turbocharger lubrication system.

Name: Engine Turbocharger 2 Speed
Description: Rotational velocity of rotor in the turbocharger.

Name: Engine Turbocharger 3 Speed
Description: Rotational velocity of rotor in the turbocharger.

Name: Engine Turbocharger 4 Speed
Description: Rotational velocity of rotor in the turbocharger.

Name: Engine Main Bearing 9 Temperature
Description: Temperature of the main bearing which supports the crankshaft of the engine.

Name: Engine Main Bearing 10 Temperature
Description: Temperature of the main bearing which supports the crankshaft of the engine.

Name: Engine Main Bearing 11 Temperature
Description: Temperature of the main bearing which supports the crankshaft of the engine.

Name: Engine Main Bearing 5 Temperature
Description: Temperature of the main bearing which supports the crankshaft of the engine.

Name: Engine Main Bearing 6 Temperature
Description: Temperature of the main bearing which supports the crankshaft of the engine.

Name: Engine Main Bearing 7 Temperature
Description: Temperature of the main bearing which supports the crankshaft of the engine.

Name: Engine Main Bearing 8 Temperature
Description: Temperature of the main bearing which supports the crankshaft of the engine.

Name: Engine Main Bearing 1 Temperature
Description: Temperature of the main bearing which supports the crankshaft of the engine.

Name: Engine Main Bearing 2 Temperature
Description: Temperature of the main bearing which supports the crankshaft of the engine.

Name: Engine Main Bearing 3 Temperature
Description: Temperature of the main bearing which supports the crankshaft of the engine.

Name: Engine Main Bearing 4 Temperature
Description: Temperature of the main bearing which supports the crankshaft of the engine.

Name: Engine Exhaust Gas Port 17 Temperature
Description: Temperature at the cylinder exhaust port of the engine.

Name: Engine Exhaust Gas Port 18 Temperature
Description: Temperature at the cylinder exhaust port of the engine.

Name: Engine Exhaust Gas Port 19 Temperature
Description: Temperature at the cylinder exhaust port of the engine.

Name: Engine Exhaust Gas Port 20 Temperature
Description: Temperature at the cylinder exhaust port of the engine.

Name: Engine Exhaust Gas Port 13 Temperature
Description: Temperature at the cylinder exhaust port of the engine.

Name: Engine Exhaust Gas Port 14 Temperature
Description: Temperature at the cylinder exhaust port of the engine.

Name: Engine Exhaust Gas Port 15 Temperature
Description: Temperature at the cylinder exhaust port of the engine.

Name: Engine Exhaust Gas Port 16 Temperature
Description: Temperature at the cylinder exhaust port of the engine.

Name: Engine Exhaust Gas Port 9 Temperature
Description: Temperature at the cylinder exhaust port of the engine.

Name: Engine Exhaust Gas Port 10 Temperature
Description: Temperature at the cylinder exhaust port of the engine.

Name: Engine Exhaust Gas Port 11 Temperature
Description: Temperature at the cylinder exhaust port of the engine.

Name: Engine Exhaust Gas Port 12 Temperature
Description: Temperature at the cylinder exhaust port of the engine.

Name: Engine Exhaust Gas Port 5 Temperature
Description: Temperature at the cylinder exhaust port of the engine.

Name: Engine Exhaust Gas Port 6 Temperature
Description: Temperature at the cylinder exhaust port of the engine.

Name: Engine Exhaust Gas Port 7 Temperature
Description: Temperature at the cylinder exhaust port of the engine.

Name: Engine Exhaust Gas Port 8 Temperature
Description: Temperature at the cylinder exhaust port of the engine.

Name: Engine Exhaust Gas Port 1 Temperature
Description: Temperature at the cylinder exhaust port of the engine.

Name: Engine Exhaust Gas Port 2 Temperature
Description: Temperature at the cylinder exhaust port of the engine.

Name: Engine Exhaust Gas Port 3 Temperature
Description: Temperature at the cylinder exhaust port of the engine.

Name: Engine Exhaust Gas Port 4 Temperature
Description: Temperature at the cylinder exhaust port of the engine.

Name: Engine Oil Temperature 2
Description: Temperature of the engine lubricant.

Name: Engine ECU Temperature
Description: Temperature of the engine electronic control unit.

Name: Engine Exhaust Gas Recirculation Differential Pressure
Description: Differential pressure across the Exhaust Gas Recirculation (EGR) system

Name: Engine Exhaust Gas Recirculation Temperature
Description: Temperature of Recirculated Exhaust Gas

Name: Engine Intake Manifold 2 Temperature
Description: Temperature of pre-combustion air found in intake manifold of engine air supply system.

Name: Engine Intake Manifold 3 Temperature
Description: Temperature of pre-combustion air found in intake manifold of engine air supply system.

Name: Engine Intake Manifold 4 Temperature
Description: Temperature of pre-combustion air found in intake manifold of engine air supply system.

Name: Engine Intake Manifold 5 Temperature
Description: Temperature of pre-combustion air found in intake manifold number 5 of engine air supply system.

Name: Engine Intake Manifold 6 Temperature
Description: Temperature of pre-combustion air found in intake manifold  number 6 of engine air supply system.

Name: Engine Turbocharger 1 Boost Pressure
Description: Gage pressure of air measured  downstream of the compressor discharge side of the turbocharger.  See also SPN 102 for alternate range and resolution. If there is only one boost pressure to report and the range and resolution in SPN 102 is adequate, then it should be used.

Name: Engine Turbocharger 2 Boost Pressure
Description: Gage pressure of air measured  downstream of the compressor discharge side of the turbocharger.  See also SPN 102 for alternate range and resolution. If there is only one boost pressure to report and the range and resolution in SPN 102  is adequate, then it should be used.

Name: Engine Turbocharger 3 Boost Pressure
Description: Gage pressure of air measured  downstream of the compressor discharge side of the turbocharger.  See also SPN 102 for alternate range and resolution. If there is only one boost pressure to report and the range and resolution in SPN 102 is adequate, then it should be used.

Name: Engine Turbocharger 4 Boost Pressure
Description: Gage pressure of air measured  downstream of the compressor discharge side of the turbocharger.  See also SPN 102 for alternate range and resolution. If there is only one boost pressure to report and the range and resolution in SPN 102 is adequate, then it should be used.

Name: Engine Alternator Bearing 1 Temperature
Description: Temperature of the bearing inside the alternator.  Bearing 1 is the left or rear bearing.

Name: Engine Alternator Bearing 2 Temperature
Description: Temperature of the bearing inside the alternator.  Bearing 2 is the right or front bearing.

Name: Engine Alternator Winding 1 Temperature
Description: Temperature of the windings inside the alternator.

Name: Engine Alternator Winding 2 Temperature
Description: Temperature of the windings inside the alternator.

Name: Engine Alternator Winding 3 Temperature
Description: Temperature of the windings inside the alternator.

Name: Articulation Angle
Description: Angle of deflection of an articulated transit vehicle.  A right turn is indicated with a positive angle and a left turn is indicated with a negative angle.

Name: Engine Desired Rated Exhaust Oxygen
Description: The desired amount of oxygen in the exhaust at rated conditions represented as a percentage by volume with respect to the total volume of exhaust gases leaving the engine.

Name: Engine Desired Exhaust Oxygen
Description: The desired amount of oxygen in the exhaust represented as a percentage by volume with respect to the total volume of exhaust gases leaving the engine.

Name: Engine Actual Exhaust Oxygen
Description: The actual amount of oxygen in the exhaust represented as a percentage by volume with respect to the total volume of exhaust gases leaving the engine.

Name: Engine Exhaust Gas Oxygen Sensor Fueling Correction
Description: The amount of fueling change required by the system based on the measured Exhaust Oxygen value compared to the maximum fueling change permitted by the system, expressed as percentages.

Name: Engine Exhaust Gas Oxygen Sensor Closed Loop Operation
Description:
Indicates whether the engine is using the Exhaust Gas Oxygen sensor to control the air/fuel ratio.

00 Engine not using the Exhaust Gas Oxygen sensor (open loop)
01 Engine using the Exhaust Gas Oxygen sensor for a closed loop operation
10 Reserved
11 Don't Care/take no action

See also SPN 4240 for an implementation with more states.

Name: Engine Gaseous Fuel Correction Factor
Description: A correction to a predefined gaseous fuel energy (expressed in energy per unit volume) represented as a percentage.  The actual fuel energy used to control the engine is the product of the gaseous fuel correction factor and the energy of the gas.

Name: Engine Desired Absolute Intake Manifold Pressure (Turbo Boost Limit)
Description: The desired absolute intake manifold pressure of the engine.

Name: Engine Turbocharger Wastegate Valve Position
Description: The position of the turbocharger wastegate valve (not the electronic wastegate control valve).

Name: Engine Gas Mass Flow Sensor Fueling Correction
Description: The amount of fuel the Gas Mass Flow Sensor is sensing should be added or subtracted compared to the maximum amount of fuel the control system allows the sensor to add or subtract.

Name: Recommended Gear
Description: The transmission calculates this gear continuously.  In dangerous situations this gear may be selected to gain back vehicle control.
Operational Range: -125 to +125, negative values are reverse gears, positive values are forward gears, zero is neutral. 251 (0xFB) is park.

Name: Highest Possible Gear
Description: The transmission calculates this gear continuously.  Together with the lowest possible gear (see  SPN 1114), it enables a management computer to know the exact range of available gears.
Operational Range: -125 to +125, negative values are reverse gears, positive values are forward gears, zero is neutral. 251 (0xFB) is park.

Name: Lowest Possible Gear
Description: The transmission calculates this gear continuously.  Together with the highest possible gear (see SPN 1115), it enables a management computer to know the exact range of available gears.
Operational Range: -125 to +125, negative values are reverse gears, positive values are forward gears, zero is neutral. 251 (0xFB) is park.

Name: Clutch Life Remaining
Description: Signal which indicates the actual clutch life remaining in percent. One hundred percent means the clutch is brand new and zero percent means the clutch is at the end of its life.

Name: Brake Lining Remaining, Front Axle, Left Wheel
Description: The percentage of brake lining which can still be measured for the left wheel on the front axle.  100% represents new brake linings, 0% represents totally worn brake linings.

Name: Brake Lining Remaining, Front Axle, Right Wheel
Description: The percentage of brake lining which can still be measured for the right wheel on the front axle.  100% represents new brake linings, 0% represents totally worn brake linings.

Name: Brake Lining Remaining, Rear Axle #1, Left Wheel
Description: The percentage of brake lining which can still be measured for the left wheel on the rear axle #1.  100% represents new brake linings, 0% represents totally worn brake linings.

Name: Brake Lining Remaining, Rear Axle #1, Right Wheel
Description: The percentage of brake lining which can still be measured for the right wheel on the rear axle #1.  100% represents new brake linings, 0% represents totally worn brake linings.

Name: Brake Lining Remaining, Rear Axle #2, Left Wheel
Description: The percentage of brake lining which can still be measured for the left wheel on the rear axle #2.  100% represents new brake linings, 0% represents totally worn brake linings.

Name: Brake Lining Remaining, Rear Axle #2, Right Wheel
Description: The percentage of brake lining which can still be measured for the right wheel on the rear axle #2.  100% represents new brake linings, 0% represents totally worn brake linings.

Name: Brake Lining Remaining, Rear Axle #3, Left Wheel
Description: The percentage of brake lining which can still be measured for the left wheel on the rear axle #3.  100% represents new brake linings, 0% represents totally worn brake linings.

Name: Brake Lining Remaining, Rear Axle #3, Right Wheel
Description: The percentage of brake lining which can still be measured for the right wheel on the rear axle #3.  100% represents new brake linings, 0% represents totally worn brake linings.

Parameter Group Label: Wheel Application Pressure High Range Information
Name: Brake Application Pressure High Range, Front Axle, Left Wheel
Description: The brake application pressure for the left wheel on the front axle.

Parameter Group Label: Wheel Application Pressure High Range Information
Name: Brake Application Pressure High Range, Front Axle, Right Wheel
Description: The brake application pressure for the right wheel on the front axle.

Parameter Group Label: Wheel Application Pressure High Range Information
Name: Brake Application Pressure High Range, Rear Axle #1, Left Wheel
Description: The brake application pressure for the left wheel on the rear axle #1.

Parameter Group Label: Wheel Application Pressure High Range Information
Name: Brake Application Pressure High Range, Rear Axle #1, Right Wheel
Description: The brake application pressure for the right wheel on the rear axle #1.

Parameter Group Label: Wheel Application Pressure High Range Information
Name: Brake Application Pressure High Range, Rear Axle #2, Left Wheel
Description: The brake application pressure for the left wheel on the rear axle #2.

Parameter Group Label: Wheel Application Pressure High Range Information
Name: Brake Application Pressure High Range, Rear Axle #2, Right Wheel
Description: The brake application pressure for the right wheel on the rear axle #2.

Parameter Group Label: Wheel Application Pressure High Range Information
Name: Brake Application Pressure High Range, Rear Axle #3, Left Wheel
Description: The brake application pressure for the left wheel on the rear axle #3.

Parameter Group Label: Wheel Application Pressure High Range Information
Name: Brake Application Pressure High Range, Rear Axle #3, Right Wheel
Description: The brake application pressure for the right wheel on the rear axle #3.

Name: Pneumatic Supply Pressure
Description: The pneumatic pressure in the main reservoir, sometimes referred to as the wet tank.

Name: Parking and/or Trailer Air Pressure
Description: The pneumatic pressure in the circuit or reservoir for the parking brake and/or the trailer supply.

Name: Service Brake Circuit 1 Air Pressure
Description: The pneumatic pressure in the primary service brake circuit or reservoir, supplying the rear axle.

Name: Service Brake Circuit 2 Air Pressure
Description: The pneumatic pressure in the secondary service brake circuit or reservoir, supplying the front axle.

Name: Auxiliary Equipment Supply Pressure
Description: The pneumatic pressure in the auxiliary circuit.

Name: Air Suspension Supply Pressure
Description: The pneumatic pressure in the circuit for the electronically controlled air suspension system.

Name: Air Compressor Status
Description:
Indicates whether the air compressor is actively compressing air.  

00     Compressor not active
01     Compressor active
10     Error indicator
11     Not available

Name: Trip Fuel (Gaseous)
Description: Total fuel consumed (trip drive fuel + trip PTO governor moving fuel + trip PTO governor non-moving fuel + trip idle fuel) since the last trip reset.

Name: Total Fuel Used (Gaseous)
Description: Total fuel consumed (trip drive fuel + trip PTO governor moving fuel + trip PTO governor non-moving fuel + trip idle fuel) over the life of the engine.

Name: Trip Cruise Time
Description: Total time accumulated while the engine is in the cruise hold state, excluding time in accelerator override, since the last trip reset.

Name: Trip PTO Governor Time
Description: Total time accumulated while the engine is in the PTO or remote PTO governor hold state since the last trip reset.

Name: Trip Engine Running Time
Description: Total time accumulated while the engine speed is greater than zero since the last trip reset.  Note that time with the ignition switch on but engine speed at zero is not included.

Name: Trip Idle Time
Description:
Total time accumulated while the engine speed is greater than zero, both the PTO and remote PTO governors are inactive, and the vehicle speed is less than 2 km/h, since the last trip reset.

In marine applications, this parameter is defined as the total time accumulated while the engine speed is greater than zero, and less than or equal to 50 RPM greater than low idle, since the last trip reset.

Name: Trip Air Compressor On Time
Description: Total time that the air compressor is on and compressing air since the last trip reset.

Name: Total ECU Distance
Description: Total distance accumulated over the life of the ECU.  When the ECU is replaced this value shall be reset.

Name: Total ECU Run Time
Description: Total time accumulated over the life of the ECU, from ignition switch ON to ignition switch OFF.  When the ECU is replaced this value shall be reset.

Name: Total Engine PTO Governor Fuel Used (Gaseous)
Description:
Total fuel used while the PTO or remote PTO governors are in the hold state and engine speed is above zero, over the life of the engine.

NOTE—This parameter is intended for gaseous fueled engines.  See SPN 1028 for alternate resolution.

Name: Trip Average Fuel Rate (Gaseous)
Description:
Average fuel rate, equal to trip fuel divided by trip time while the engine speed is above zero, since the last trip reset.  This includes idle, engine PTO governor (both moving and non-moving) and drive operation but excludes ignition-on time while the engine speed is at zero rpm.

NOTE—This parameter is intended for gaseous fueled engines.  See SPN 1029 for alternate resolution.

Name: Engine Fuel Specific Gravity
Description: This parameter conveys the specific gravity of the gaseous fuel being used by the engine.  The specific gravity of the fuel can then be used to compute the density of the fuel.

Name: Total Engine PTO Governor Fuel Used
Description:
Total fuel used while the PTO or remote PTO governors are in the hold state and engine speed is above zero, over the life of the engine.

NOTE—This parameter is intended for liquid fueled engines.  See SPN 1030 for alternate resolution.

Name: Trip Average Fuel Rate
Description:
Average fuel rate, equal to trip fuel divided by trip time while the engine speed is above zero, since the last trip reset.  This includes idle, engine PTO governor (both moving and non-moving) and drive operation but excludes ignition-on time while the engine speed is at zero rpm.

NOTE—This parameter is intended for liquid fueled engines.  See SPN 1031 for alternate resolution.

Name: Trip Time in VSL
Description: Total time accumulated when the engine has operated on the vehicle speed limiter (VSL) while not in the cruise hold state, since the last trip reset.  The engine torque mode is equal to road speed governor during this operation.

Name: Trip Time in Top Gear
Description: Total time accumulated when the vehicle has operated in top gear for a calibrated minimum time, since the last trip reset.

Name: Trip Time in Gear Down
Description: Total time accumulated when the vehicle has operated in one gear down from the top gear for a calibrated minimum time, since the last trip reset.

Name: Trip Time in Derate by Engine
Description: Total time accumulated when the engine final fueling has been derated due to an engine protection algorithm, since the last reset.

Name: Trip Number of Hot Shutdowns
Description: Total number of hot shutdowns since the last trip reset.  A hot shutdown is based on operation at high load or high engine speed or for long operating periods without allowing the engine to cool sufficiently.

Name: Trip Number of Idle Shutdowns
Description: Total number of times the engine has been shutdown due to idling too long (at normal idle or fast idle) since the last trip reset.

Name: Trip Number of Idle Shutdown Overrides
Description: Total number of times an operator disables idle shutdown to prevent an engine shutdown, since the last trip reset.

Name: Trip Sudden Decelerations
Description: Total number of decelerations whenever the vehicle deceleration is more than XYZ km/h/sec (where XYZ is a calibratible threshold), since the last trip reset.  A lengthy deceleration shall be counted as one sudden deceleration.

Name: Trip Maximum Vehicle Speed
Description: Maximum vehicle speed achieved while the engine speed is greater than zero and the accelerator pedal position (APS) is at a value greater than 0%, since the last trip reset.

Name: Trip Cruise Distance
Description: Total distance that the engine has operated in the cruise hold state, excluding time in accelerator override, since the last trip reset.

Name: Trip Maximum Engine Speed
Description: Maximum engine speed achieved since the last trip reset.

Name: Trip Average Engine Speed
Description:
Average speed of the engine since the last trip reset.

NOTE — Excludes ignition-on time without the engine speed above zero.  Includes idle, engine PTO governor (moving and non-moving), and drive operation.

Name: Trip Drive Average Load Factor
Description:
Average engine load factor while engine speed is greater than zero, vehicle speed is greater than or equal to 2 km/h, and both the PTO (moving/non-moving) and remote PTO governors are not in the hold state, since the last trip reset.  Engine operation during cruise control operation is included.

In marine applications, this parameter is defined as the average engine load factor while engine speed is greater than zero, since last trip reset.

Name: Total Drive Average Load Factor
Description:
Average engine load factor while engine speed is greater than zero, vehicle speed is greater than or equal to 2 km/h, and both the PTO (moving/non-moving) and remote PTO governors are not in the hold state, over the life of the engine.  Engine operation during cruise control operation is included.

In marine applications, this parameter is defined as the average engine load factor while engine speed is greater than zero.

Name: Total Engine Cruise Time
Description: Total time that the engine has operated in the cruise hold state, excluding time in accelerator override, over the life of the engine.

Name: Trip Drive Fuel Used (Gaseous)
Description:
Total fuel consumed while the engine speed is greater than zero, vehicle speed is greater than or equal to 2 km/h, and neither the PTO or the remote PTO governors are controlling the engine power output, since the last trip reset.

NOTE—This parameter is intended for gaseous fueled engines.  See SPN 1001 for alternate resolution.

Name: Trip PTO Governor Moving Fuel Used (Gaseous)
Description:
Total fuel consumed while the PTO or remote PTO governors are in the hold state, the engine speed is greater than zero, and vehicle speed is greater than or equal to 2 km/h, since the last trip reset.

NOTE—This parameter is intended for gaseous fueled engines.  See SPN 1002 for alternate resolution.

Name: Trip PTO Governor Non-moving Fuel Used (Gaseous)
Description:
Total fuel consumed while the PTO or remote PTO governors are in the hold state, the engine speed is greater than zero, and vehicle speed is less than to 2 km/h, since the last trip reset.

NOTE—This parameter is intended for gaseous fueled engines.  See SPN 1003 for alternate resolution.

Name: Trip Vehicle Idle Fuel Used (Gaseous)
Description:
Total fuel consumed while neither the PTO or remote PTO governors are active, the engine speed is greater than zero, and vehicle speed is less than to 2 km/h, since the last trip reset.

NOTE—This parameter is intended for gaseous fueled engines.  See SPN 1004 for alternate resolution.  Trip vehicle idle fuel while in fast idle (vehicle speed less than 2 km/h with engine speed greater than 700 rpm) shall be accumulated in the trip vehicle idle fuel category.  All other fuel usage scenarios that do not fall directly in the categories defined shall be accumulated in trip drive fuel used.

Name: Trip Cruise Fuel Used (Gaseous)
Description:
Total fuel consumed while the engine is in the cruise hold state since the last trip reset.  If both cruise control and VSL (vehicle speed limiter) are commanding the same amount of fuel, the cruise control is deemed the active torque mode and fuel will be accumulated in "trip cruise fuel used" parameter.  If fuel commanded due to the accelerator pedal position is larger than fuel commanded by cruise control (e.g., accelerator override torque mode), the cruise control is not deemed the active torque mode and fuel will not be accumulated in the "trip cruise fuel used" parameter.

NOTE—This parameter is intended for gaseous fueled engines.  See SPN 1005 for alternate resolution.

Name: Trip Drive Fuel Economy (Gaseous)
Description:
Trip drive fuel economy is equal to the distance traveled by vehicle in the drive state (engine speed greater than zero, vehicle speed greater than or equal to 2 km/h, and neither the PTO or remote PTO governors are controlling engine power output) divided by trip drive fuel used (SPN 1007), since the last trip reset.

NOTE—This parameter is intended for gaseous fueled engines.  See SPN 1006 for alternate resolution.

Name: Trip Drive Fuel Used
Description:
Total fuel consumed while the engine speed is greater than zero, vehicle speed is greater than or equal to 2 km/h, and neither the PTO or the remote PTO is controlling the engine power output, since the last trip reset.

NOTE—This parameter is intended for liquid fueled engines.  See SPN 1007 for alternate resolution.

Name: Trip PTO Governor Moving Fuel Used
Description:
Total fuel consumed while either the PTO or remote PTO governors are in the hold state, the engine speed is greater than zero, and vehicle speed is greater than or equal to 2 km/h, since the last trip reset.

NOTE—This parameter is intended for liquid fueled engines.  See SPN 1008 for alternate resolution.

Name: Trip PTO Governor Non-moving Fuel Used
Description:
Total fuel consumed while either the PTO or remote PTO governors are in the hold state, the engine speed is greater than zero, and vehicle speed is less than 2 km/h, since the last trip reset.

NOTE—This parameter is intended for liquid fueled engines.  See SPN 1009 for alternate resolution.

Name: Trip Vehicle Idle Fuel Used
Description:
Total fuel consumed while neither the PTO or remote PTO governor is in the hold state, the engine speed is greater than zero, and vehicle speed is less than 2 km/h, since the last trip reset.

In marine applications, this parameter is defined as the total fuel consumed while the engine speed is greater than zero, and less than or equal to 50 RPM greater than low idle, since the last trip reset.

NOTE—This parameter is intended for liquid fueled engines.  See SPN 1010 for alternate resolution.

Name: Trip Cruise Fuel Used
Description:
Total fuel consumed while the engine is in the cruise hold state since the last trip reset.  If both cruise control and VSL (vehicle speed limiter) are commanding the same amount of fuel, the cruise control is deemed the active torque mode and fuel will be accumulated in "trip cruise fuel used" parameter.  If fuel commanded due to the accelerator pedal position is larger than fuel commanded by cruise control (e.g., accelerator override torque mode), the cruise control is not deemed the active torque mode and fuel will not be accumulated in the "trip cruise fuel used" parameter.

NOTE—This parameter is intended for liquid fueled engines.  See SPN 1011 for alternate resolution.

Name: Trip Drive Fuel Economy
Description:
Trip drive fuel economy is equal to the distance traveled by vehicle in the drive state (engine speed greater than zero, vehicle speed greater than or equal to 2 km/h, and neither the PTO or remote PTO governors are controlling engine power output) divided by trip drive fuel used (SPN 1001), since the last trip reset.

NOTE—This parameter is intended for liquid fueled engines.  See SPN 1012 for alternate resolution.

Name: Trip Distance on VSL
Description: Total distance accumulated while the engine torque mode is road speed governing since the last trip reset.

Name: Trip Gear Down Distance
Description: Total distance accumulated while the vehicle has operated in the gear which is one gear down from top gear and exceeds a calibrated minimum time (typically the time to shift the transmission) since the last trip reset.

Name: Trip Distance in Top Gear
Description: Total distance accumulated while the vehicle has operated in top gear for a calibrated minimum time since the last trip reset.

Name: Trip Fan On Time
Description:
Total time the fan has been on (due to an automatic trigger or manual trigger) since the last trip reset.  The fan could be requested to be on by the engine system, a manual switch, and/or the A/C system.  Whichever system requests the fan activation first shall have the time accumulated against it.  The sum total of these three values shall equal the trip fan on time.

NOTE—If the fan has been requested to be on by a component that is not one of the defined categories, this time shall be accumulated in the Engine System category by default.

Name: Trip Fan On Time Due to the Engine System
Description: Total time the fan has been on due to engine triggers (i.e., excluding time on due to an operator manual switch or A/C system) since the last trip reset.  For the time to be accumulated against the engine system, it is necessary that it be the first to request the fan activation or it be the only system requesting fan activation.

Name: Trip Fan On Time Due to a Manual Switch
Description: Total time the fan has been on due to manual activation by the operator (i.e., excluding time on due to automatic triggers) since the last trip reset.  For the time to be accumulated against the manual switch, it is necessary that it be the first to request the fan activation or it be the only system requesting fan activation.

Name: Trip Fan On Time Due to the A/C System
Description: Total time the fan has been on due to the A/C system since the last trip reset.  For the time to be accumulated against the A/C system, it is necessary that it be the first to request the fan activation or it be the only system requesting fan activation.

Name: Total Compression Brake Distance
Description: Total distance over which the compression brakes have been active for the life of the engine.

Name: Trip Compression Brake Distance
Description: Total distance over which the compression brakes have been active since the last trip reset.

Name: Trip Service Brake Distance
Description: Total distance over which the service brakes have been active since the last trip reset.

Name: Trip Service Brake Applications
Description:
Total number of times the service brakes have been activated since the last trip reset.  Brake applications of less than 0.5 s are not counted and lengthy brake applications (longer than 0.5 s) are counted as a single event.

NOTE - Definition and resolution shall stay the same if brakes are applied by only the tractor, only the trailer or both.

Name: Estimated Percent Fan Speed
Description:
Estimated fan speed as a ratio of the fan drive (current speed) to the fully engaged fan drive (maximum fan speed).  A two state fan (off/on) will use 0% and 100% respectively.  A three state fan (off/intermediate/on) will use 0%, 50% and 100% respectively.  A variable speed fan will use 0% to 100%. Multiple fan systems will use 0 to 100% to indicate the percent cooling capacity being provided.

Note that the intermediate fan speed of a three state fan will vary with different fan drives, therefore 50% is being used to indicate that the intermediate speed is required from the fan drive.

Name: Fan Drive State
Description:
This parameter is used to indicate the current state or mode of operation by the fan drive.

0000 Fan off
0001 Engine system–General
0010 Excessive engine air temperature
0011 Excessive engine oil temperature
0100 Excessive engine coolant temperature
0101 Excessive transmission oil temperature
0110 Excessive hydraulic oil temperature
0111 Default Operation
1000 Not defined
1001 Manual control
1010 Transmission retarder
1011 A/C system
1100 Timer
1101 Engine brake
1110 Other
1111 Not available

Fan off  0000b —Used to indicate that the fan clutch is disengaged and the fan is inactive

Engine system–General  0001b —Used to indicate that the fan is active due to an engine system not otherwise defined.

Excessive engine air temperature  0010b —Used to indicate that the fan is active due to high air temperature.

Excessive engine oil temperature  0011b —Used to indicate that the fan is active due to high oil temperature.

Excessive engine coolant temperature  0100b —Used to indicate that the fan is active due to high coolant temperature.

Manual control  1001b —Used to indicate that the fan is active as requested by the operator.

Transmission retarder  1010b —Used to indicate that the fan is active as required by the transmission retarder.

A/C system  1011b —Used to indicate that the fan is active as required by the air conditioning system.

Timer  1100b —Used to indicate that the fan is active as required by a timing function.

Engine brake  1101b —Used to indicate that the fan is active as required to assist engine braking.

Excessive transmission oil temperature - 0101b  - Used to indicate fan is active due to excessive transmission oil temperature.

Excessive hydraulic oil temperature - 0110b - Used to indicate fan is active due to excessive hydraulic oil temperature.

Default Operation - 0111b - Used to indicate fan is active due to a error condition resulting in default operation

Name: Fan Speed
Description: The speed of the fan associated with engine coolant system.

Name: Hydraulic Fan Motor Pressure
Description: The hydraulic pressure used to drive the fan system, sensed before the hydraulic fan motor.

Name: Fan Drive Bypass Command Status
Description: Status of the Fan Drive Bypass Command as being commanded by the ECU.  The fan drive bypass diverts pump pressure away from the hydraulic motor to maintain the fan drive pressure.  0% is defined as no bypass (i.e. diverting no fan drive pressure) and 100% is defined as full bypass (i.e. diverting the maximum fan drive pressure) from the fan motor.

Name: Engine Rated Power
Description: Net brake power that the engine will deliver continuously, specified for a given application at a rated speed.

Name: Engine Rated Speed
Description: The maximum governed rotational velocity of the engine crankshaft under full load conditions.  Note that the engine speed at point 2 (SPN 528) is equal to rated engine speed only in the case when the engine has not been derated.  Please also reference PGN 65251.

Name: Engine Rotation Direction
Description:
Direction of engine rotation, as reported by the engine.  Direction convention as viewed by an observer standing at the rear of the engine, viewing the flywheel.

00 - CounterClockWise (CCW)
01 - ClockWise (CW)
10 - Reserved
11 - Not Available

Name: Crank Attempt Count on Present Start Attempt
Description:
Reports the number of cranking cycles undergone during the present start attempt.

Note:  This is intended to be used in conjunction with Maximum Crank Attempts per Start Attempt, in order to give a FMI 0 diagnostic on this parameter when the count exceeds the maximum.  When the engine is not in a start attempt, this parameter can either hold the last value or return a Not Available (0xFF).

Name: Front Axle Speed
Description: The average speed of the two front wheels.

Name: Relative Speed; Front Axle, Left Wheel
Description: The speed of the front axle, left wheel relative to the front axle speed, SPN 904.

Name: Relative Speed; Front Axle, Right Wheel
Description: The speed of the front axle, right wheel relative to the front axle speed, SPN 904.

Name: Relative Speed; Rear Axle #1, Left Wheel
Description: The speed of the rear axle #1, left wheel relative to the front axle speed, SPN 904.

Name: Relative Speed; Rear Axle #1, Right Wheel
Description: The speed of the rear axle #1, right wheel relative to the front axle speed, SPN 904.

Name: Relative Speed; Rear Axle #2, Left Wheel
Description: The speed of the rear axle #2, left wheel relative to the front axle speed, SPN 904.

Name: Relative Speed; Rear Axle #2, Right Wheel
Description: The speed of the rear axle #2, right wheel relative to the front axle speed, SPN 904.

Name: Service Component Identification
Description: Identification of component needing service.  See Table SPN911_A.

Name: Service Distance
Description: The distance which can be traveled by the vehicle before the next service inspection is required.  A negative distance is transmitted if the service inspection has been passed.  The component that requires service is identified by the service component identification (see SPN 911-913, 1379, and 1584).

Name: Service Component Identification
Description: Identification of component needing service.  See Table SPN911_A.

Name: Service Delay/Calendar Time Based
Description: The time in weeks until the next vehicle service inspection is required.  A negative value is transmitted if the service inspection has been passed.  The component that requires service is identified by the service component identification (see SPN 911-913, 1379, and 1584).

Name: Service Component Identification
Description: Identification of component needing service.  See Table SPN911_A.

Name: Service Delay/Operational Time Based
Description: The time in vehicle operational time until the next vehicle service inspection is required.  A negative value is transmitted if the service inspection has been passed.  The component that requires service is identified by the service component identification (see SPN 911-913, 1379, and 1584).

Name: High Resolution Total Vehicle Distance
Description:
Accumulated distance traveled by the vehicle during its operation.

NOTE - See SPN 245 for alternate resolution.

Name: High Resolution Trip Distance
Description:
Distance traveled during all or part of a journey.

NOTE - See SPN 244 for alternate resolution.

Transmission Rate: 1 s when active; or on change of state

Name: Transmission Synchronizer Brake Value

Name: Transmission Shift Finger Gear Position

Name: Transmission Shift Finger Rail Position

Name: Alternator Speed
Description: Actual rotation speed of the alternator.

Name: Alternator 1 Status
Description:
Alternator 1 operating status.
